meanings.definition: To perform less well than expected or required.
meanings.sent1: The student tends to underperform in math class.
meanings.sent2: The team underperformed in the championship game.
meanings.sent3: Even with extra study sessions, he still managed to underperform on the test.
meanings.sent4: Her old computer started to underperform, struggling to keep up with the new software.
meanings.sent5: The car's engine began to underperform, making strange noises and losing power.

meanings.definition: To fail to achieve a desired level of performance.
meanings.sent1: The company continues to underperform in sales this quarter.
meanings.sent2: Despite his efforts, he underperformed in the marathon and didn't finish.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick underperformed, leaving the audience unimpressed.
meanings.sent4: The plant underperformed in the dry soil, struggling to grow.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight started to underperform, casting a dim light in the darkness.
